cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande (or 275 mi ENE of Tampico, Mexico)
cyclone.trajectory: expected to drift north-northeast through Saturday, then slow and turn west toward the western Gulf and the Texas coast, eventually bending northwest toward the mid-Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid-Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: western Gulf coast from northern Mexico to Louisiana, with greatest threat along the Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: 30–45 mph tropical-storm-force winds possible (38 % chance overall) with higher gusts if the center tracks closer
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore easterly flow could drive 2–4 ft of surge in Corpus Christi and Nueces/Aransas Bays, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement may cause 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals, leading to urban and low-land flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, minor coastal erosion
